title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: many document types coded ADAMS effectively show plot (.e., > 180). result, Type field binned facilitate bar plot various reactor applications. data can also plotted bars unstacked.
code: library(ggplot2) docket_types = combined_dockets |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),   ) |>   nrcadams::simplify_type()  type_count = docket_types |>   dplyr::filter(NLWR) |>   dplyr::count(Type, sort = TRUE) |>   dplyr::arrange(n)   plt = docket_types |>   dplyr::mutate(Type = factor(Type, levels = type_count |> dplyr::pull(Type))) |>   ggplot() +     geom_bar(aes(y = Project, fill = Type)) +     theme_bw() +     scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1") +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     xlab("Document Count")  plt |> plotly::ggplotly(tooltip = c("Type", "count")) plt = docket_types |>   dplyr::mutate(Type = factor(Type, levels = type_count |> dplyr::pull(Type))) |>   ggplot() +     geom_bar(aes(y = Project, fill = Type), position = position_dodge()) +     theme_bw() +     scale_fill_brewer(palette="Set1") +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     xlab("Document Count")  plt |> plotly::ggplotly(tooltip = c("Type", "count"))

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: plot shows number documents submitted docket. Plot order sorted highest number documents, NuScale 50 MWe Part 52 lowest number documents, Aalo-1 Pre-App..

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: cumulative number documents given ADAMS docket also presented function document date. Due large number plots, suggested use interactive plot filter function. clicking project name legend, can remove project plot better focus remaining projects. data linear scale: data y axis semi log scale:
code: plot_min_date = "2020-01-01" |> lubridate::ymd()  grouped_dockets = combined_dockets |>   dplyr::group_by(Project) |>   dplyr::arrange(`Publish Date`) |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),     count = 1,     `Document Count` = cumsum(count),     `Publish Date` = `Publish Date` |> lubridate::as_date()     )   plt = grouped_dockets |>   dplyr::filter(`Publish Date` > plot_min_date) |>   ggplot() +     geom_step(aes(x = `Publish Date`, y = `Document Count`, color = Project)) +     theme_bw() +     theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1)) +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     scale_y_continuous(       breaks= seq(         0,          max(grouped_dockets$`Document Count`),          by = 200         )       ) +     scale_x_continuous(       breaks= seq(         min(plot_min_date),          max(grouped_dockets$`Publish Date` |> lubridate::as_date()) ,          by = "quarter"         )       ) plt |> plotly::ggplotly() plt = plt + scale_y_log10()  plt |> plotly::ggplotly()

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: section work progress Dockets can often cluttered affidavits, meeting notices, documents can obscure insights. Reclassifying documents using simplify_type function removing type can help see really going docket. Warning, order see happening docket, y-axis allowed rescale docket. can make comparing dockets difficult.
code: grouped_project_type <-  combined_dockets |>   nrcadams::simplify_type() |>   dplyr::filter(!Type == "Other") |>   dplyr::group_by(Project, Type) |>   dplyr::arrange(`Publish Date`) |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),     count = 1,     `Document Count` = cumsum(count),     `Publish Date` = `Publish Date` |> lubridate::as_date()     )   plt <- grouped_project_type |>     dplyr::filter(lubridate::as_date(`Publish Date`) > plot_min_date) |>   ggplot() +     geom_step(aes(x = `Publish Date`, y = `Document Count`, color = Type)) +     theme_bw() +     theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 90, vjust = 0.5, hjust=1)) +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +     scale_x_continuous(       breaks= seq(         min(plot_min_date),          max(grouped_project_type$`Publish Date` |> lubridate::as_date()) ,          by = "quarter"         )       ) +     facet_grid(vars(Project), scales = "free_y")  plt |> plotly::ggplotly()

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: daily document rate provides metric gauge level interactions project NRC given point time. Unlikely cumulative plots, metric memory-less thus impacted prior interactions. Due large number plots, suggested use interactive plot filter function. clicking project name legend, can remove project plot better focus remaining projects. Unfortunately, data plot bit clustered hard pinpoint trend given docket. Facet plots can separate given docket easily decipher trends.
code: smoothed_grouped_dockets = combined_dockets |>   dplyr::arrange(`Publish Date`) |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = factor(Project, levels = docket_count |> dplyr::pull(Project)),     count = 1,     `Day Published` = paste(       `Publish Date` |> lubridate::year(),        `Publish Date` |> lubridate::month(),        `Publish Date` |> lubridate::day(),       sep = '/'       ) |> lubridate::ymd()     ) |>   dplyr::group_by(`Day Published`, Project) |>   dplyr::summarise(`Daily Document Count` = sum(count)) |>   dplyr::group_by(Project) |>   tidyr::complete(     `Day Published` = seq.Date(       min(`Day Published`),        max(`Day Published`),        by = "day"       ),     fill = list(`Daily Document Count` = 0)     ) |>   dplyr::mutate(     `Smoothed Daily Document Rate` = zoo::rollmean(       `Daily Document Count`, k = 30, na.pad = TRUE, align = "center"       )     )   plt = smoothed_grouped_dockets |>   dplyr::filter(`Day Published` > plot_min_date) |>   ggplot() +     geom_step(       aes(x = `Day Published`, y = `Smoothed Daily Document Rate`, color = Project)     ) +     theme_bw() +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +   scale_y_continuous(     breaks= seq(       0,        max(smoothed_grouped_dockets$`Smoothed Daily Document Rate`, na.rm = TRUE),        by=1       )     ) +   scale_x_date(     breaks= seq(       plot_min_date,        max(smoothed_grouped_dockets$`Day Published`),        by = "year")     )  plt |> plotly::ggplotly() facet_dockets =  smoothed_grouped_dockets |>   dplyr::mutate(     Project = dplyr::case_when(       Project |> stringr::str_detect("Part 50") ~ Project |> stringr::str_replace(" Part 50", ""),       Project |> stringr::str_detect("Part 52") ~ Project |> stringr::str_replace(" Part 52", ""),       Project |> stringr::str_detect("Part 70") ~ Project |> stringr::str_replace(" Part 70", ""),       TRUE ~ Project |> stringr::str_replace(" Pre-App.", "")       )     ) |>   tidyr::pivot_longer(     c(`Daily Document Count`, `Smoothed Daily Document Rate`),      names_to = "Plot Type",     values_to = "count"     ) |>   dplyr::mutate(     `Plot Type` = dplyr::case_when(       `Plot Type` == "Daily Document Count" ~ "Raw Counts",       TRUE ~ "Smoothed"     ),     count = count |> signif(1)   )  plt = facet_dockets |>     dplyr::filter(`Day Published` > plot_min_date) |>   ggplot() +     geom_step(       aes(x = `Day Published`, y = count, color = `Plot Type`)     ) +     theme_bw() +     theme(legend.position="top") +     labs(       title = "Advanced Reactor ADAMS Documents",       subtitle =  paste("as of", Sys.Date())     ) +   scale_y_continuous(     breaks= seq(       0,        6,        by=1       ),     limits = c(0,5.5)     ) +   scale_x_date(     breaks= seq(       plot_min_date,        max(facet_dockets$`Day Published`),        by = "year")     ) +   facet_grid(vars(Project)) +   ylab("Daily Document Count")  plt |> plotly::ggplotly()

title: Docket Analytics and Reports
text: basic docket information parsed previous sections, basic summary statistics can computed compare state various dockets glance.
code: seconds_per_year = 365 * 24 *60 *60 smoothed_grouped_dockets |>   dplyr::group_by(Project) |>   dplyr::summarise(     `First Date` = min(`Day Published`[`Daily Document Count` > 0]),     `Last Date` = max(`Day Published`[`Daily Document Count` > 0]),     `Total` = sum(`Daily Document Count`),     `Years` = round(lubridate::interval(`First Date`, `Last Date`) |> lubridate::int_length() / seconds_per_year, digits = 2),     `Yearly Rate` = round(Total / Years, digits = 2)     ) |>   DT::datatable()

text: following table summarizes tagged Topical Reports.

title: Docket Search
text: One confusing aspects NRC’s document repository NRC assigns docket numbers. pre-application engagement, companies assigned docket number starts 999. NRC accepts companies license application review, NRC assign docket number based upon type license. example, companies applying traditional two stage license Part 50 docket number begins 050. Companies applying combined operating license Part 52 docket number begins 052. Even applicant receives docket number given facility design, applicant may still submit documents pre-application docket information support future licensing submittals.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |>   DT::datatable(     caption = "Exported Docket Numbers in the `nrcadams` Package.",     filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE)     )

what: Keeping Up to Date with a Docket
title: Docket Search
text: open regulator, NRC required publicly provide non-proprietary non-export controlled information public. applicant submits proprietary document, NRC post non-proprietary portions document ADAMS. NRC typically strives ensure enough information public sphere justify licensing actions. keep --date ACU’s MSRR license, best search pre-application docketed information.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |> dplyr::filter(Company == "ACU") |> dplyr::pull(DocketNumber) |> nrcadams::search_docket(days_back = 60) |> dplyr::mutate(Title = paste0("", Title, '')) |> dplyr::select(-URL) |> DT::datatable( caption = "The last 60 Days of the MSRR's Posted Licensing Documents.", filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE), escape = FALSE ) #> Searching with the following URL: #> https://adams.nrc.gov/wba/services/search/advanced/nrc?q=(mode:sections,sections:(filters:(public-library:!t),properties_search_any:!(!(DocketNumber,eq,'99902088',''),!(DocketNumber,eq,'05000610','')),properties_search_all:!(!(PublishDatePARS,gt,'07/26/2024',''))))&qn=New&tab=advanced-search-pars&z=0 #> : 1.179 sec elapsed #> #> This search returned: 11 files.

what: Filtering a Docket for Actual Information
title: Docket Search
text: given docket include email correspondence addition reports safety evaluations. Generally, letters emails noise signal can filtered search results. Instead mucking around ADAMS API filter results, simpler use dplyr::filter filter returned results.
code: nrcadams::docket_codex |> dplyr::filter(Company == "X-Energy") |> dplyr::pull(DocketNumber) |> nrcadams::search_docket() |> dplyr::filter( !stringr::str_detect(Type, "E-Mail"), !stringr::str_detect(Type, "Letter") )|> dplyr::mutate(Title = paste0("", Title, '')) |> dplyr::select(-URL) |> DT::datatable( caption = "X-Energy's Pre-Applicaion Docket without Letters and Emails.", filter = list(position = 'top', clear = TRUE, plain = FALSE), escape = FALSE ) #> Searching with the following URL: #> https://adams.nrc.gov/wba/services/search/advanced/nrc?q=(mode:sections,sections:(filters:(public-library:!t),properties_search_any:!(!(DocketNumber,eq,'99902071',''),!(DocketNumber,eq,'07007027',''),!(DocketNumber,eq,'99902117',''))))&qn=New&tab=advanced-search-pars&z=0 #> : 4.371 sec elapsed #> #> This search returned: 1000 files. #> Warning in nrcadams::search_docket(dplyr::pull(dplyr::filter(nrcadams::docket_codex, : #> This search returned more than 1000 results and thus may be incomplete. what: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: R package used pull data NRC’s ADAMS document repository. ever want keep track recent back forth applicants NRC find NRC web based ADAMS searches cumbersome? , package might !

title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: R package based tidyverse, R tidyverse installation recommended. Web based ADAMS results processed xml, xml2 package prerequisite. package programmed using base R pipes, versions R greater 4.1 required. Please install package using remotes: package unlikely published CRAN.
code: remotes::install_github("mrdenman-nuclear/nrcadams")

title: Pulls Data from NRC's ADAMS database
text: nrcadams package fairly limited time. key functionality runs search_docket. least one docket number required, can filter results specifying many days past want search well search terms. function outputs tibble results including URLs documents.
code: ACU_MSRR <- c(99902088, 05000610) ACU_MSRR |>   nrcadams::search_docket(     days_back = 20,     search_term = "Acceptance"     )
